intro: Eremodendron cunninghamii, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow floral spikes, which are produced in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is typically found in dry, open habitats. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, known for its nitrogen-fixing ability. Eremodendron cunninghamii is an important component of the Australian flora and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
